form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Udall of Colorado introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To clarify the disposition of covered persons detained in the United States pursuant to the Authorization for Use of Military Force, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Due Process and Military Detention Amendments Act of 2013 .

section.header: Disposition of covered persons detained in the United States pursuant to the Authorization for Use of Military Force
section.text: Section 1021 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012 (Public Law 112–81; 125 Stat. 1562; 10 U.S.C. 801 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking The disposition and inserting Except as provided in subsection (g), the disposition; and
by adding at the end the following new subsections:

subsection.header: Disposition of covered persons detained in the United States

paragraph.header: Persons detained pursuant to this Act or the Authorization for Use of Military Force
paragraph.text: In the case of a covered person who is detained in the United States pursuant to this Act or the Authorization for Use of Military Force, disposition under the law of war shall occur immediately upon the person coming into custody of the United States Government and shall only mean the immediate transfer of the person for trial and proceedings with all the due process rights as provided for under the Constitution of the United States.

paragraph.header: Prohibition on transfer to military custody
paragraph.text: No person detained, captured, or arrested in the United States, or a territory or possession of the United States, may be transferred to the custody of the Armed Forces for detention under this Act or the Authorization for Use of Military Force.

subsection.text: This section shall not be construed to authorize the detention of a person within the United States, or a territory or possession of the United States, under this Act or the Authorization for Use of Military Force.

section.header: Repeal of requirement for military custody

subsection.text: Section 1022 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012 (Public Law 112–81; 125 Stat. 1563; 10 U.S.C. 801 note) is hereby repealed.
Section 1029(b) of such Act (125 Stat. 1570) is amended by striking applies to and all that follows through any other person and inserting applies to any person.
